content:
I tend to agree with you, but I can't offer any methods.

Fundamentally for Thunderbird it is not so much a problem as in the core of things not much changed from the time Thunderbird support migrated to this site until version 115 was released. Even then it is more user interface changes than capabilities.

Does this have something to do with https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1444449 in which case nothing relevant has changed and you will be going through the same sort of diagnostics now as you would have years ago.

content:
Se le immagini non solo allegate alla mail, è normale che sia così. È una misura di sicurezza contro phishing ed altre truffe informatiche. In cima al messaggio dovrebbe però apparirti un messaggio su fondo giallo che ti permette di scaricare le immagini remote per quel messaggio ed eventualmente di creare una regole per scaricarle sempre da quel mittente.

Se il problema non è questo, prova a fornire più dettagli e magari uno screenshot del problema stesso.
creator: @next

Ripetendo l'ultimo aggiornamento è possibile ripristinare quello che ora a me forse manca ? Grazie dell'attenzione. Cordiali saluti G.F.
creator: graziafiorel

content: - install import-export addon if not already done - switch to first profile - highlight desired message folder, rightclick and select import-export entry and select to export as eml files to a local directory - repeat for each message folder, exporting to same local directory - switch to next profile and repeat the process - when done, switch to master profile - create new Local Folder to retain the exported messagess - highlight the folder and select the import-export option to import eml files - install the 'removedupes' addon to remove duplicates
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David,

Thanks for your quick response.

Is this Import export tool and removedupes developed by Mozila or any other 3rd party. Please advise which ones are reliable.

Will this exercise maintain the folder/directory structure like the Inbox mails should be in Inbox and Sent ones in the same sent folder etc?
creator: junkboxtv

content: Addons are developed by individual contributors and rely on donations. The folder structure will be however you wish to arrange it, since I assume you will be creating and importing in whichever structure you wish. That is, once you create a local folder, you can create subfolders from the parent folder.
creator: davidsk

content: The simple solution is to set a primary password. That prevents showing the password.
creator: davidsk

content:
Primary Password is not the answer

TB prevents people from viewing the password security alright and it also prevents people from sending emails alright but it allows people to view emails - not all right

Whats the point of having a Primary Password, and Thunderbird allows people to view emails, simply pres escape multiple times and your in. and then it pesters you for the primary password all the time

Passwords are critical security points

I see 2 scenarios 1 Password protect all of TB - Primary Password 2 Password protect the Password section, or disable it. 

  I dont want anyone to see my passwords

Thank you, but I need a Solution for the Password Section, alone
creator: icenews

content:
The fix you want has been in review for almost five years. In bugzilla at 

  https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1566458     so, will they ever stop debating and implement a simple solution? We can only hope. Latest update on the bug indicates we may be getting closer to fixing this. I share your concerns and my opinion is already in the bug report.
creator: davidsk

content:
Hi David,

I feel we are getting off subject. The Link provided discusses Primary passwords, not what I am looking for.

My Problem is the following: I need to disable the "SHOW PASSWORD" Button in the Security Section

I want to Secure (or Disable) that Button It reveals all of my passwords Anyone can gain access to it.

I am ok with Users to Send, receive and read messages, But I don't want them to view the (SMTP, IMAP) email passwords Currently, they can simply do this by pressing the "SHOW PASSWORD" button

I need a solution for this problem

In the past, I was able to disable this button by creating a "user.js" file with following Switch: user_pref("pref.privacy.disable_button.view_passwords", true);

This option does not work any longer. TB Resets it to False, all the time. and it does not perform the task required

Please advise Thank you
creator: icenews

content: First, I think we're on same topic. I mentioned primary password because, although flawed, setting it does address the very issue that concerns you. I agree that it is 'half a loaf', but addresses the issue of not being able to see passwords. Second, as a courtesy, I filed a bug report at https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1891512 so it is at least on file. I haven't the slightest guess on whether this will be done soon or sit idle for years.
creator: davidsk

content:
Se hai attivato l'autenticazione a 2 fattori, leggi la guida di Aruba per configurare i client -> https://guide.pec.it/posta-pec/gestione-account/password/come-generare-la-password-per-programma-di-posta.aspx

Altrimenti segui le indicazioni del messaggio ed assicurati che nelle impostazioni account il metodo di autenticazione per il server SMTP sia quello indicato da Aruba.
